text.div:
This case-insensitive code system http://worldhealthorganization.github.io/smart-hiv/CodeSystem/HIV.B defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
DE1 Reason for visitReason for HIV testing services visit
DE2 First-time HIV testFirst encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
DE3 Retesting for HIVRetesting for human immunodeficiency virus
DE4 HIV testing services visitClient attending facility for HIV testing services visit
DE5 Referred through partner servicesClient reported coming to the facility after receiving a provider-assisted referral or patient referral from a contact or partner
DE6 Partner or contact of an index caseThe client is a contact or partner of a person diagnosed with HIV (an index case)
DE7 Partner or contact of an HIV testing client (non-index case)The client is a contact or partner identified through partner or social network services, but is not known to be a partner of an index-case
DE8 Type of contact or partner for partner servicesClient's relationship to the person that referred the client for partner services or family services
DE9 Biological childClient is the biological child of the person that referred the client for family services
DE10 Drug-injecting partnerClient is a drug-injecting partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
DE11 Sexual partnerClient is a sexual partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
DE12 Social contactClient is a social contact of the person that referred the client for social-network services
DE13 Contact with and (suspected) exposure to HIVWhen the client is reported to have had suspected exposure to HIV
DE14 Date/time of suspected exposure to HIVDate and time when the client had suspected exposure to HIV
DE15 Testing entry pointWhether testing is happening in the community or at a facility
DE16 Community-level testingTesting is happening in the community, which includes mobile testing
DE17 Facility-level testingWhere the testing is happening â€“ at a facility
DE18 Entry point for community-level testingSpecific point in the community where testing is happening
DE19 Mobile testing (e.g. through vans or temporary testing facilities)The client tested through mobile testing, such as through vans or temporary testing facilities
DE20 Voluntary counselling and testing centres (not within a health facility setting)The client tested at a voluntary counselling and testing centre (not in a health facility setting)
DE21 Other community-based testingThe client tested through another type of community-based testing
DE22 Entry point for facility-level testingSpecific point where testing is happening at a facility
DE23 Provider-initiated tested in a clinic or emergency facilityThe client tested though provider-initiated HIV testing & counselling, which could be at an emergency facility
DE24 Antenatal care clinicThe client tested at an antenatal care clinic, including labour and delivery
DE25 Voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)The client tested through voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)
DE26 Family planning clinicThe client tested at a family planning clinic
DE27 Other facility-level testingThe client tested at another type of facility
DE28 Tuberculosis (TB) clinicThe client tested at a TB clinic
DE29 Currently pregnantClient is currently pregnant
DE30 Gestational ageGestational age in weeks and/or days depending on the source of gestational age
DE31 Expected date of delivery (EDD)Expected date of delivery based on gestational age
DE32 BreastfeedingInfant is being breastfed by mother
DE33 Partner HIV status (reported)The HIV status of the client's partner.
DE34 HIV-positiveClient's partner is HIV-positive
DE35 HIV-negativeClient's partner is HIV-negative
DE36 UnknownDon't know HIV status - client does not know partner's HIV status
DE37 Partner is from a key population*Client's partner is a member of a key population, that has an increased risk of HIV
DE38 Sex workerClient's partner is a sex worker
DE39 Men who have sex with menClient's partner is a man who has sex with men
DE40 Transgender peopleClient's partner is transgender
DE41 People who inject drugsClient's partner is a person who injects drugs
DE42 People living in prisons and other closed settingsClient's partner lives in a prison or other closed setting
DE43 Has used an HIV self-test before (reported)The client reported having used an HIV self-test before
DE44 HIV self-test resultResults from the reported HIV self-test
DE45 ReactiveThe HIV self-test was reactive
DE46 Non-reactiveThe HIV self-test was non-reactive
DE47 InvalidThe HIV self-test was invalid
DE48 Date of HIV self-testDate when the HIV self-test was conducted
DE49 Key population member*Client is a member of a key population that has an increased risk of HIV
DE50 Key population member type*The type of key population that the client is included in
DE51 Sex workerClient is a sex worker
DE52 Men who have sex with menClient is a man who has sex with men
DE53 Transgender peopleClient is transgender
DE54 People who inject drugsClient is a person who injects drugs
DE55 People living in prisons and other closed settingsClient lives in a prison or another closed setting
DE56 Adolescent girlCalculated field based on age and gender, if client is 10 years or older and under 20 years old
DE57 Young womanCalculated field based on age and gender, if client is 20 years or older and under 25 years old
DE58 Orphan or vulnerable childClient considered an orphan or vulnerable child
DE59 Informed of HIV test resultClient has been informed of their HIV test result
DE60 Date HIV test results returnedDate HIV test result returned to client
DE61 HIV exposure type*Ways in which the client was exposed to HIV
DE62 OccupationalOccupational exposure to HIV
DE63 Non-occupational violentNon-occupational violent exposure to HIV
DE64 Non-occupational consensual sexExposure to HIV through non-occupational consensual sex
DE65 Date informed of HIV-positive diagnosisThe date on which the client was diagnosed with HIV
DE66 HIV diagnosing facilityThe facility where the client received an HIV-positive diagnosis
DE67 Date of first positive test indicative of HIV diagnosisEarliest date of HIV diagnosis determined according to the national HIV testing algorithm
DE68 HIV serotypeThe client's HIV serotype
DE69 HIV-1The client has HIV-1
DE70 HIV-2The client has HIV-2
DE71 HIV diagnosis dateDate diagnosis was returned to client
DE72 ART start dateThe date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
DE73 Age at diagnosisThe client's age (in years) when given an HIV diagnosis
DE74 Type of contact elicitedClient's relationship to the contact identified for voluntary partner services or family services
DE75 Biological childContact identified for family services is the biological child of the client
DE76 Drug-injecting partnerContact identified for partner services is a drug-injecting partner of the client
DE77 Sexual partnerContact identified for partner services is a sexual partner of the client
DE78 Social contactContact identified for social-network services is a social contact of the client
DE79 HIV test orderedAn HIV test of the client was ordered by the provider
DE80 HIV test conductedAn HIV test was performed on the client during the visit
DE81 HIV test typeType of HIV test
DE82 Rapid diagnostic test for HIVAntibody test for HIV performed with a rapid diagnostic
DE83 Enzyme immunoassay for HIVAntibody test for HIV performed with an enzyme immunoassay
DE84 Nucleic acid test for HIVVirological test, which includes testing for early infant diagnosis
DE85 Dual HIV/syphilis rapid diagnostic testAntibody test for HIV and syphilis performed with a rapid diagnostic
DE86 HIV self-testAntibody test for HIV performed by self-tester using a rapid diagnostic
DE87 Date HIV test sentDate HIV specimen was sent to lab
DE88 Assay number in testing strategyThe number of the assay (test kit) in the HIV testing strategy
DE89 Assay 0A community outreach test-for-triage or self-test which is not included in the HIV testing strategy
DE90 Assay 1The first test in the HIV testing strategy
DE91 Assay 2The second test in the HIV testing strategy
DE92 Assay 3The third test in the HIV testing strategy
DE93 Assay 1 repeatedThe first test in the HIV testing strategy
DE94 Test result of HIV assay 1The result of the first HIV assay in the testing strategy
DE95 ReactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was reactive
DE96 Non-reactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was non-reactive
DE97 InvalidThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was invalid
DE98 Test result of HIV assay 2The result of the second HIV assay in the testing strategy
DE99 ReactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was reactive
DE100 Non-reactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was non-reactive
DE101 InvalidThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was invalid
DE102 Test result of HIV assay 3The result of the third HIV assay in the testing strategy
DE103 ReactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was reactive
DE104 Non-reactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was non-reactive
DE105 InvalidThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was invalid
DE106 Test result of HIV assay 1 repeatedThe result of the repeated first HIV assay in the testing strategy
DE107 ReactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was reactive
DE108 Non-reactiveThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was non-reactive
DE109 InvalidThe result of the HIV assay in the testing strategy was invalid
DE110 HIV test dateDate of the HIV test
DE111 HIV test resultThe result from HIV testing after applying the testing algorithm
DE112 HIV-positiveTest result is HIV-positive
DE113 HIV-negativeTest result is HIV-negative
DE114 HIV-inconclusiveTest result is HIV-inconclusive
DE115 HIV statusHIV status reported after applying the national HIV testing algorithm. No single HIV test can provide an HIV-positive diagnosis.
DE116 HIV-positiveClient is HIV-positive
DE117 HIV-negativeClient is HIV-negative
DE118 UnknownClient has unknown HIV status
DE119 Date positive HIV test confirmedDate patient received positive HIV test confirmation (with written documentation)
DE120 Site where positive HIV test confirmedName or identifier of health facility where HIV test was confirmed
DE121 Probable route of transmission*Probable route(s) of transmission of HIV to client
DE122 Heterosexual sexProbable route of HIV transmission was through heterosexual sex
DE123 Sex between menProbable route of HIV transmission was through sex between men
DE124 Unprotected intercourse during sex workProbable route of HIV transmission was through unprotected intercourse during sex work
DE125 Injecting drug use with unsterile equipmentProbable route of HIV transmission was through injecting drug use with unsterile equipment
DE126 NosocomialProbable route of HIV transmission was nosocomial
DE127 VerticalProbable route of HIV transmission to an infant was during pregnancy, labour, delivery and breastfeeding (vertical transmission)
DE128 OtherProbable route of HIV transmission was other and may include needle accidents, blood transfusion, blood products or organ/tissue donations, tattoos, piercings, circumcision, or acupuncture.
DE129 Partner HIV test conductedIf the client does not know the HIV status of the client's partner(s), offer to test and add results here
DE130 Partner HIV test orderedAn HIV test for the client's partner has been ordered
DE131 Partner HIV test dateDate of client's partner's HIV test
DE132 Partner HIV test resultThe HIV test result of the client's partner
DE133 HIV-positiveTest result is HIV-positive
DE134 HIV-negativeTest result is HIV-negative
DE135 HIV-inconclusiveTest result is HIV-inconclusive
DE136 Partner HIV status (confirmed)The HIV status of a sexual or drug-injecting partner of the client, based on a confirmed test result
DE137 HIV-positiveClient's partner is HIV-positive
DE138 HIV-negativeClient's partner is HIV-negative
DE139 UnknownClient's partner HIV status is unknown
DE140 Partner on ARTPartner of the client is on ART
DE141 Partner virally suppressed on ARTART and virally suppression status of a partner of the client
DE142 Counselling providedWhether counselling was provided to a client during the visit
DE143 HIV-positive counselling conductedWhether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with HIV
DE144 Hepatitis B positive counselling conductedWhether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with hepatitis B
DE145 Hepatitis C positive counselling conductedWhether counselling was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with hepatitis C
DE146 Syphilis counselling, treatment and further testingWhether counselling and treatment was provided to a client who has been diagnosed with syphilis. Additional testing (RPR test) recommended.
DE147 Linked to enrolment in care and ART initiationLinkage made from HIV testing to enrolment in care following an HIV diagnosis
DE148 VMMC counselling providedWhether counselling for voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) was provided following an HIV-negative test
DE149 Prevention services offered and referralsOffer or refer to prevention services
DE150 Offer male and female condoms and condom-compatible lubricantsOffer male and female condoms and condom-compatible lubricants
DE151 Offer pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) for people at elevated risk for HIV acquisitionOffer pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) to people with substantial ongoing risk of HIV infection
DE152 Offer post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP) following suspected exposureOffer or refer client for PEP following suspected exposure
DE153 Voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC)Offer referral for VMMC services
DE154 Harm reduction for people who inject drugsOffer or refer to harm reduction services for people who inject drugs (needle and syringe programmes, opioid substitution therapy, other drug-dependence treatment and opioid overdose prevention and management)
DE155 Behavioural interventions to support risk reduction, particularly for people with HIV and members of key populationsOffer or refer to behavioural interventions to support risk reduction, particularly for people with HIV and members of key populations
DE156 HIV testing for partners and biological childrenOffer voluntary testing for all partners and biological children of positive cases (includes partner services and index case testing), as welll as partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate
DE157 HIV testing for partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriateOffer voluntary testing for partners and social contacts of people from key populations, where appropriate
DE158 Sexual and reproductive health integrated servicesOffer or refer to sexual and reproductive health services
DE159 Contraception and family planningOffer contraception and family planning services
DE160 Check pregnancy statusCheck women's pregnancy status
DE161 Prevention of mother-to-child transmission counsellingOffer services for prevention of mother-to-child transmission (counselling)
DE162 Cervical cancer screening and treatment counsellingOffer cervical cancer screening and treatment counselling and services
DE163 Anal cancer screening (for men who have sex with men)Offer services for anal cancer screening (for men who have sex with men)
DE164 STI testing and treatment servicesOffer sexually transmitted infection (STI) testing and treatment services
DE165 Offer other clinical servicesOther clinical services offered or referrals given to the client
DE166 Assessment and provision of vaccinationsAssessment and provision of vaccinations, such as for people from key populations, pregnant women and infants; and, where appropriate, tetanus vaccination for adolescent boys and men receiving VMMC
DE167 Hepatitis B (HBV) and hepatitis C virus (HCV) testing and treatment providedOffer or refer for HBV and/or HCV testing and treatment
DE168 Co-trimoxazole chemoprophylaxis to prevent Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia providedOffer or refer for co-trimoxazole chemoprophylaxis to prevent pneumocystis carinii pneumonia
DE169 Intensified TB case finding and linkage to TB treatment providedOffer or refer for intensified TB case finding and linkage to TB treatment
DE170 Provision of isoniazid preventive therapy if person does not have TBOffer or refer for provision of isoniazid preventive therapy if person does not have TB
DE171 Malaria prevention (such as bed nets and prophylaxis), depending on epidemiologyOffer or refer for malaria prevention (such as bed nets and prophylaxis), depending on epidemiology
DE172 Other support servicesOffer or refer for other support services
DE173 Mental health servicesOffer or refer for mental health services
DE174 Psychosocial counselling, support and treatment adherence counsellingOffer or refer for psychosocial counselling, support and treatment adherence counselling
DE175 Support for disclosure and partner servicesOffer or refer for support for disclosure and partner services
DE176 Legal and social servicesOffer or refer for legal and social services
DE177 Services for responding to violence against womenOffer or refer for services for responding to violence against women, including first-line support and psychosocial support, post-rape care and other support services including shelters, legal services and women and child protection services
DE178 Clinical enquiry for intimate partner violence (IPV) doneWhether a clinical enquiry for intimate partner violence was conducted
DE179 Intimate partner violence enquiry resultsResult of medical inquiry for intimate partner violence
DE180 Client received treatment and/or counselling as neededClient received treatment and/or counselling as needed
DE181 Client was referredClient was referred to another provider/facility
DE182 No action necessaryNo additional action was deemed necessary
DE183 Other IPV resultOther intimate partner violence (IPV) result not described above
DE184 Other IPV result (specify)Other intimate partner violence (IPV) result not described above (specify)
DE185 Offered voluntary partner servicesWhether the client was offered voluntary partner services or family services
DE186 Count of contacts or partners given for social network-based/partner servicesThe quantity of contacts or partners given by a client that accepts social network-based/partner services for follow-up
DE187 Offered social network-based/partner servicesWhether the client was offered social network-based partner services
DE188 Accepted social network-based/partner servicesWhether the client accepted social network-based partner services
DE189 Contact first name to offer social network-based/partner servicesFirst name of each contact given by the client to offer social network-based/partner services
DE190 Contact last name to offer social network-based/partner servicesLast or family name of each contact given by the client to offer social network-based/partner services
DE191 Type of follow-up appointmentType of follow-up appointment for testing services
DE192 Retesting for HIVRetesting follow-up appointment
DE193 OtherOther reason for the follow-up appointment
DE194 Other reason for the follow-up appointment (specify)Other reason for the follow-up appointment (specify)
DE195 Date/time of follow-up appointmentDate the patient is to return for monitoring, re-supply or any other reason
DE196 Recommended follow-up dateDate when follow-up is recommended based on follow up requirements
DE197 VMMC procedureWhether a voluntary medical male circumcision procedure was performed
DE198 VMMC procedure dateDate on which a voluntary medical male circumcision procedure was performed
DE199 Adverse event reported from a VMMCWhether an adverse event was reported associated with a voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) procedure
DE200 Serious adverse eventComplications from voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) procedure resulted in death or hospitalization within 30 days of the procedure or permanent disability
DE201 Adverse event severitySeverity of the adverse event associated with voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) procedure
DE202 ModerateSeverity of the adverse event associated with VMMC procedure was moderate
DE203 SevereSeverity of the adverse event associated with VMMC procedure was severe
DE204 Timing of adverse eventWhen the adverse event associated with VMMC procedure occurred
DE205 IntraoperativeThe adverse event associated with VMMC procedure occurred during the procedure
DE206 PostoperativeThe adverse event associated with VMMC procedure occurred within the first 30 days after the procedure
DE207 Type of adverse VMMC eventType of adverse event associated with voluntary medical male circumcision (VMMC) procedure
DE208 Abnormal painClient experienced abnormal pain
DE209 Anaesthesia-related effectsClient had anaesthesia-related effects
DE210 BleedingClient had bleeding
DE211 Damage to the penisClient had damage to the penis
DE212 Difficulty urinatingClient had difficulty urinating
DE213 Excessive bleedingClient experienced excessive bleeding
DE214 Excessive skin removalClient experienced excessive skin removal
DE215 Excessive swellingClient experienced excessive swelling
DE216 HaematomaClient experienced haematoma
DE217 InfectionClient experienced infection
DE218 Injury to glansClient experienced injury to glans
DE219 Scar or disfigurementClient experienced scar or disfigurement
DE220 Sharps injury to personnelDuring VMMC procedure there was sharps injury to personnel
DE221 Wound disruptionClient experienced wound disruption
DE222 OtherClient experienced other adverse VMMC event
DE223 Other (specify)Client experienced other adverse VMMC event (specify)
DE224 HIV retest prior to starting ART conductedHIV retest prior to starting ART conducted
DE225 At elevated risk for HIV acquisitionClient is at elevated risk for HIV acquisition
DE226 Syndrome/STI diagnosedSyndrome or STI for which client is diagnosed
DE227 Urethral discharge syndromeClient diagnosed with urethral discharge syndrome
DE228 Vaginal discharge syndromeClient diagnosed with vaginal discharge syndrome
DE229 Lower Abdominal pain Client diagnosed with lower abdominal pain
DE230 Genital ulcer disease syndromeClient diagnosed with genital ulcer disease syndrome
DE231 Anorectal dischargeClient diagnosed with anorectal discharge
DE232 Sent for testingSpecimen sent for testing
DE233 OtherOther syndrome/STI diagnosed
DE234 Other (specify)Other syndrome/STI diagnosed (specify)
DE235 Any STI syndrome diagnosedWas the client diagnosed with any of the five STI syndromes during this visit?
DE236 Date of STI testDate on which the STI test was conducted
DE237 STI tested forSTI for which the client was tested
DE238 Neisseria gonorrhoeaeClient tested for Neisseria gonorrhoeae
DE239 Chlamydia trachomatisClient tested for Chlamydia trachomatis
DE240 Trichomonas vaginalisClient tested for Trichomonas vaginalis
DE241 Syphilis (Treponema pallidum)Client tested for Syphilis (treponema pallidum)
DE242 Herpes simplex virus (HSV1, HSV2)Client tested for herpes simplex virus (HSV1, HSV2)
DE243 Mycoplasma genitaliumClient tested for Mycoplasma genitalium
DE244 MpoxClient tested for Mpox
DE245 Hepatitis BClient tested for Hepatitis B
DE246 Hepatitis CClient tested for Hepatitis C
DE247 OtherClient tested for other STI
DE248 Other (specify)Client tested for other STI (specify)
DE249 Syphilis test dateDate of syphilis test
DE250 Syphilis test resultResult from syphilis test
DE251 PositiveTest result is positive for syphilis
DE252 NegativeTest result is negative for syphilis
DE253 InconclusiveTest result is inconclusive
DE254 Syphilis treatment start dateDate of initiation of syphilis treatment
DE255 Gonorrhoea test dateDate of Gonorrhoea test
DE256 Gonorrhoea test resultResult from Gonorrhoea test
DE257 PositiveTest result is positive for Neisseria gonorrhoeae
DE258 NegativeTest result is negative for Neisseria gonorrhoeae
DE259 InconclusiveTest result is inconclusive
DE260 Gonorrhoea treatment start dateDate of initiation of Gonorrhoea treatment
DE261 Type of specimenType of specimen to be collected
DE262 BloodBlood specimen to be collected
DE263 UrineUrine specimen to be collected
DE264 Cervical or vaginal swabCervical or vaginal swab to be collected
DE265 Urethral or penile swabUrethral or penile swab to be collected
DE266 Rectal swabRectal swab to be collected
DE267 OtherOther specimen type to be collected
DE268 Other type of specimen (specify)Other specimen type to be collected (specify)
DE269 Syphilis test typeType of diagnostic test used for syphilis (treponema pallidum)
DE270 TreponemalTreponemal test used
DE271 Non-treponemalNon-treponemal test used
DE272 POC TestPoint-of-care (POC) test used
DE273 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE274 OtherOther test used
DE275 Other syphilis test type (specify)Other test used (specify)
DE276 Neisseria gonorrhoeae test typeType of diagnostic test used for Neisseria gonorrhoeae
DE277 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE278 POC TestPoint-of-care (POC) test used
DE279 CultureCulture test used
DE280 MicroscopyMicroscopy test used
DE281 OtherOther type of test used
DE282 Other (specify)Other type of test used (specify)
DE283 POC Test for Neisseria gonorrhoeae (specify)Point-of-care (POC) test used for Neisseria gonorrhoeae (specify)
DE284 Chlamydia trachomatis test typeType of diagnostic test used for Chlamydia trachomatis
DE285 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE286 POC TestPoint-of-care (POC) test used
DE287 CultureCulture test used
DE288 ELISAELISA test used
DE289 MicroscopyMicroscopy test used
DE290 OtherOther type of test used
DE291 Other test for Chlamydia (specify)Other type of test used for Chlaymdia (specify)
DE292 POC Test type for Chlamydia test (specify)Point-of-care (POC) test used for Chlamydia (specify)
DE293 Trichomonas vaginalis test typeType of diagnostic test used for Trichomonas vaginalis
DE294 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE295 POC TestPoint-of-care (POC) test used
DE296 CultureCulture test used
DE297 MicroscopyMicroscopy test used
DE298 OtherOther type of test used
DE299 Other (specify)Other type of test used (specify)
DE300 POC Test type for Trichomonas vaginalis test (specify)Point-of-care (POC) test used (specify)
DE301 Herpes simplex virus (HSV) test typeType of diagnostic test used for herpes simplex virus (HSV)
DE302 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE303 Antibody test Antibody test used
DE304 OtherOther type of test used
DE305 Other (specify)Other type of test used for Herpes simplex virus (HSV) test (specify)
DE306 Mycoplasma genitalium test typeType of diagnostic test used for Mycoplasma genitalium
DE307 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE308 Microscopy Microscopy test used
DE309 OtherOther type of test used
DE310 Other (specify)Other type of test used for Mycoplasma genitalium test (specify)
DE311 Test type for other STI tested for (specify)Test type used for the other specified STI
DE312 STI test resultResult from STI test
DE313 PositiveTest result is positive
DE314 NegativeTest result is negative
DE315 InconclusiveTest result is inconclusive
DE316 Date of STI confirmatory testDate of STI confirmatory test
DE317 Confirmatory syphilis test typeType of test ued for confirmatory syphilis test
DE318 TreponemalTreponemal test used
DE319 Non-treponemalNon-treponemal test used
DE320 POC TestPoint-of-care (POC) test used
DE321 NAATNucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
DE322 OtherOther test used
DE323 Other (specify)Other test used for confirmatory syphilis test (specify)
DE324 Confirmatory test type for other STI (specify)Confirmatory test type for other STI
DE325 Confirmatory STI test resultResult from confirmatory STI test
DE326 PositiveTest result is positive
DE327 NegativeTest result is negative
DE328 InconclusiveTest result is inconclusive
DE329 Date STI treatment prescribed Date STI treatment was prescribed to the client
DE330 Date STI treatment dispensedDate STI treatment dispensed to the client
DE331 STI treatment dispensed (specify)STI treatment dispensed to the client

name: HIV_B
title: HIV.B HTS visit  CodeSystem
description: CodeSystem for HIV.B HTS visit  Data Elements

concept.definition: Reason for HIV testing services visit
First encounter for screening for human immunodeficiency virus
Retesting for human immunodeficiency virus
Client attending facility for HIV testing services visit
Client reported coming to the facility after receiving a provider-assisted referral or patient referral from a contact or partner

concept.display: Partner or contact of an index case
concept.definition: The client is a contact or partner of a person diagnosed with HIV (an index case)

concept.display: Partner or contact of an HIV testing client (non-index case)
concept.definition: The client is a contact or partner identified through partner or social network services, but is not known to be a partner of an index-case

concept.display: Type of contact or partner for partner services
concept.definition: Client's relationship to the person that referred the client for partner services or family services
Client is the biological child of the person that referred the client for family services
Client is a drug-injecting partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
Client is a sexual partner of the person that referred the client for partner services
Client is a social contact of the person that referred the client for social-network services

concept.display: Contact with and (suspected) exposure to HIV
concept.definition: When the client is reported to have had suspected exposure to HIV

concept.display: Date/time of suspected exposure to HIV
concept.definition: Date and time when the client had suspected exposure to HIV
Whether testing is happening in the community or at a facility
Testing is happening in the community, which includes mobile testing
Where the testing is happening â€“ at a facility
Specific point in the community where testing is happening

concept.display: Mobile testing (e.g. through vans or temporary testing facilities)
concept.definition: The client tested through mobile testing, such as through vans or temporary testing facilities

concept.display: Voluntary counselling and testing centres (not within a health facility setting)
concept.definition: The client tested at a voluntary counselling and testing centre (not in a health facility setting)
The client tested through another type of community-based testing
Specific point where testing is happening at a facility

concept.display: Provider-initiated tested in a clinic or emergency facility
concept.definition: The client tested though provider-initiated HIV testing & counselling, which could be at an emergency facility
The client tested at an antenatal care clinic, including labour and delivery

concept.display: Voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)
concept.definition: The client tested through voluntary counselling and testing (within a health facility setting)
The client tested at a family planning clinic
The client tested at another type of facility
The client tested at a TB clinic
Client is currently pregnant
Gestational age in weeks and/or days depending on the source of gestational age
Expected date of delivery based on gestational age
Infant is being breastfed by mother
The HIV status of the client's partner.
Client's partner is HIV-positive
Client's partner is HIV-negative
Don't know HIV status - client does not know partner's HIV status

concept.display: Partner is from a key population*
concept.definition: Client's partner is a member of a key population, that has an increased risk of HIV
Client's partner is a sex worker

concept.display: Men who have sex with men
concept.definition: Client's partner is a man who has sex with men
Client's partner is transgender
Client's partner is a person who injects drugs

concept.display: People living in prisons and other closed settings
concept.definition: Client's partner lives in a prison or other closed setting

concept.display: Has used an HIV self-test before (reported)
concept.definition: The client reported having used an HIV self-test before
Results from the reported HIV self-test
The HIV self-test was reactive
The HIV self-test was non-reactive
The HIV self-test was invalid
Date when the HIV self-test was conducted
Client is a member of a key population that has an increased risk of HIV
The type of key population that the client is included in
Client is a sex worker

concept.display: Men who have sex with men
concept.definition: Client is a man who has sex with men
Client is transgender
Client is a person who injects drugs

concept.display: People living in prisons and other closed settings
concept.definition: Client lives in a prison or another closed setting
Calculated field based on age and gender, if client is 10 years or older and under 20 years old
Calculated field based on age and gender, if client is 20 years or older and under 25 years old
Client considered an orphan or vulnerable child
Client has been informed of their HIV test result
Date HIV test result returned to client
Ways in which the client was exposed to HIV
Occupational exposure to HIV
Non-occupational violent exposure to HIV
Exposure to HIV through non-occupational consensual sex
The date on which the client was diagnosed with HIV
The facility where the client received an HIV-positive diagnosis

concept.display: Date of first positive test indicative of HIV diagnosis
concept.definition: Earliest date of HIV diagnosis determined according to the national HIV testing algorithm
The client's HIV serotype
The client has HIV-1
The client has HIV-2
Date diagnosis was returned to client
The date on which the client started or restarted antiretroviral therapy (ART)
The client's age (in years) when given an HIV diagnosis
Client's relationship to the contact identified for voluntary partner services or family services
Contact identified for family services is the biological child of the client
Contact identified for partner services is a drug-injecting partner of the client
Contact identified for partner services is a sexual partner of the client
Contact identified for social-network services is a social contact of the client
An HIV test of the client was ordered by the provider
An HIV test was performed on the client during the visit
Type of HIV test
Antibody test for HIV performed with a rapid diagnostic
Antibody test for HIV performed with an enzyme immunoassay
